article:
Making friends is a skill. Like most skills, it gets better with _ .  If you want to make friends, you must do _ for it. Join a club or a group. Talking with those who like the same things as you do is much _ .
Many people are  nervous when talking to people.  After all, meeting _ means facing the unknown .  And it's human nature to feel a bit _ about the unknown.
Most of our fears about dealing with new people come from doubts about ourselves. We _  other people are judging us, finding us too tall or too short, too thin or too fat. But don't forget that they must be feeling the _ way. Try to accept yourself as you are, and try to put the other person at ease. In this way you'll feel comfortable.
Try to be self-confident even if you don't feel that way when you enter a room full of strangers such as a big hall, walk straight in, look at people in the eye and _ . If you see someone you'd like to say something to, don't wait for the other person to start a conversation. Talk about the things you like and do best. People will be _ in you if there's something good about you.
There are many ways to make friends. Just remember, it's hard to make friends if you stay at home alone. It takes _ and effort to develop friendship.
